meanings.definition: To provide insurance for an insurance policy that has already been issued.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to reinsure their policy to protect against any unexpected losses.
meanings.sent2: After purchasing the new car, they chose to reinsure it for added security.
meanings.sent3: The idea to reinsure the insurance policy seemed like a double safety net.
meanings.sent4: She likened reinsuring the policy to having a backup plan in case of emergencies.
meanings.sent5: Reinsuring the policy felt like wrapping it in a protective shield.

meanings.definition: To obtain insurance for something that has already been insured.
meanings.sent1: They decided to reinsure their jewelry collection for extra peace of mind.
meanings.sent2: The homeowner chose to reinsure the property to ensure full coverage.
meanings.sent3: Reinsuring the already insured car felt like adding an extra layer of protection.
meanings.sent4: He thought of reinsuring the antique vase as a way to safeguard its value.
meanings.sent5: Reinsuring the valuable artwork was like adding a safety lock to its protection.
